cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 195 miles ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest, then turning northwest and slowing, heading toward the southeast Louisiana–Mississippi coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the mouth of the Mississippi River or the southeast Louisiana / Mississippi coastline

weather_observation.warning_coast: Morgan City, LA to Ocean Springs, MS including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana across Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds likely Monday; hurricane-force winds possible Monday night into Tuesday as the center nears landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–7 ft surge possible from Port Fourchon to the mouth of the Mississippi River, including areas adjacent to the port complex.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with isolated totals up to 24 inches expected over southeast Louisiana, producing significant flash-flood risk around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes beginning Monday afternoon; dangerous surf and rip currents.
